result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were canceled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Pierre M. Burke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All of the costs for the sentenced counts in this case (Counts 1 and 3) have been paid in fully from the cash bond that had been posted.

With work release/huber and stayed until on or before November 1, 2014 between 6-7 a.m.
Concurrent with: Jail counts in this case are concurrent with each other but consecutive to any other sentences defendant is serving including the Grant County sentence.
Concurrent with Count 1 but consecutive to any other jail sentence Defendant is serving including Grant County jail sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Pierre M. Burke

records.addlTxt: to Dismiss
State's motion to dismiss DPA (forwarded to the Court for review, along with proposed order for the same)

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Pierre M. Burke
Current: 105 Green St, Boscobel, WI 53805 United States  (Effective: 11-16-2016)
Prior: 606 Center St., Boscobel, WI 53805 United States
from Office of the District Attorney Grant County for certified copy of JOC; Paid 5/23/16
RCSD Disposition of warrant or commitment

ADDRESS INFO for Pierre M. Burke
Current: 606 Center St., Boscobel, WI 53805 United States  (Effective: 10-15-2014)
Prior: 606 Center Street, Boscobel, WI 53805 United States

DA Harper, Def, and Atty. Covey.  Counsel inform the Court that they've reached an agreement for resolution.  DA offers amendments on counts 1 and 3 - count 1 to be amended to mis. theft; count 3 to be amended to mis. bail jumping.  Agreement calls for 120 days jail for counts 1 and 3, concurrent with each other but conseuctive to any other sentence (has been sentenced in Grant and will be starting that shortly), no restitution; 24 mo deferred pros. agreement on count 2.

Counsel address the Court - ask that, for count 2, during the d.a., def have a signature bond and that the cash on hand with the cash bond be applied to court costs associated with counts 1 and 3.

Def pleads guilty to all three counts including counts 1 and 3 as amended.  Court's colloquy re pleas.  Finding of guilty.  

Sentence:  120 days jail on counts 1 and 3, concurrent with each other but consecutive to any other sentences serving including Grant Co. sentence, with huber.  On count 2 - Court approves 24-mo diversion agreement.  Court orders $1000 sig. bond in lieu of cash but orders cash to be applied towards costs which will include DNA surcharge.

13 days credit.

Def is scheduled to report for Grant Co. case on or before 10-31-14.  Atty. Covey asks for a report date in this Richland County case for Nov. 1.  Atty. Covey will be writing a letter to the Richland County Jail, explaining the jail reporting scenario.
PB called clerk of court stating had address change. Was instructed to submit change of address in writing.
Status conference on October 15, 2014 at 10:00 am.

DA Harper, Def, and Atty. Covey.  DA states that the parties have reached an agreement but another case, in Grant Co., needs to resolve first; asks for reset after Sep. 5th when the Grant Co. case is scheduled.  Atty. Covey clarifies that the parties don't have the full agreement yet as it will be determined by what happens in Grant Co.  Status conference scheduled for 10-15-2014 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Pierre M. Burke
Current: 606 Center Street, Boscobel, WI 53805 United States  (Effective: 08-04-2014)
Prior: 6590 Riverview Ln Lot F3, Boscobel, WI 53805 United States

phone call from def - he has moved to 606 Center St., Boscobel, WI; clerk has informed def that she would make note of this information but will not update the def's address in CCAP until the def provides notice of this change in writing; when written notice of the address is received, the clerk will update the def's record accordingly
Status conference on August 20, 2014 at 11:00 am.

DA Harper, Def, and Atty. Covey.  DA states that two jurisdictions are in play; other offenses arise out of same date has these charges and those are being prosecuted in Grant County.  DA asks for reset of this matter.  Atty. Covey states that parties are working on a global resolution for the alleged single course of action that involved both counties; asks for status as possible plea date in mid-August.  Status conference scheduled for 08-20-2014 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Pierre M. Burke
Current: 6590 Riverview Ln Lot F3, Boscobel, WI 53805 United States  (Effective: 06-30-2014)
Prior: 6590 Riverview Lane Lot F3, Boscobel, WI 53805
Status conference on July 2, 2014 at 10:00 am.

DA Harper, Def, and Atty. Covey.  Defense indicates that the def wishes to waive his right to prelim.  The State has filed the information.  Court's colloquy with def re waiver of prelim.  Court accepts prelim waiver as voluntarily and intelligently made.  To the charges contained in the information (same as the complaint), def stands mute for entry of NG pleas.  Status requested and set.  Status conference scheduled for 07-02-2014 at 10:00 am.
Atty M Covey
To Those Posting Cash Bond (AB)
Preliminary hearing on May 28, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Michael E Covey in court with Defendant Pierre M. Burke who is in custody. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Def stands mute to charges, Atty Covey waives time limits on the preliminary hearing as well as formal reading of the complaint. Court informs def of the charges/maximum, possible penalties. Court accepts def's waiver of the time periods. Def wishes to address issue of bond, requests signature bond. Argument by DA. Court will amend to $1000 cash bond with same conditions.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 28, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
No contact with Jessica L. Deckert (DOB 04/19/1989) or her residence.
from Atty. Covey - faxed letter request re bond

Written minutes.  Bond set at $1200 signature bond.  This is NOT an amended bond, just a second bond as, at the point of the bail hearing, the DA had not determined if she would be filing one or two cases.

(This hearing was requested and held as the officer generated a separate blue sheet containing a charge of forgery.  A second, separate bail was set at $1200 signature bond.)
Initial appearance rescheduled to May 5 at 1:30
written minutes - bond set at $1200 cash and initial appr set for May 1 at 1:15
